description.narrative: Gender audits have been undertaken for three partner organisations in Uganda (Semuliki, Rwenzori and SSA). The partner has further sensitised leaderships of these organisations on gender equality and has been collecting ideas on possible themes in the various sectors for advocacy emphasizing on gender dimension. As a result of training project staff, gender responsive approaches have been adopted by partners being supported. More capacity building sessions and community conversations sessions are lined up in order to change perceptions on gender equality. The organisation has trained 80(40 men& 40 women) gender focal persons and 40 model couples from 4 core partners supported by ACFODE (Semiliki, Ruwenzori Coffee , UCCFS and SSA) and all these will champion gender equality work within these organisations.

This project aims at enhancing the cpacity of We Effect's partner organizations in Uganda to analyse and integrate gender equalty perspectives into their development work. Further, this partner will take the lead in advocating for necessary policy and legislative changes within the country to ensure that they are gender responsive. This project will ensure that there is increased participation of women and young people in the development projects being implemented in Uganda. It is expected that this project will support partners within rural development and adequate housing sectors to enhance their attention towards meaningful participation of women as well as participation in relevant gender equality forums.

activity-date.narrative: Planned end date of the activity
Planned start date of the activity
